info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 1:29PM MDT until July 29 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across southern portions of the Cameron Peak Burn Area (just north of Glen Haven). Between 0.6 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.6 inches are possible in the warned area. Life threatening flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the southern portions of the Cameron Peak burn area, just north of Glen Haven, in Central Larimer County This includes the following additional locations... Dunraven Glade Road, Miller Fork, The Retreat, Storm Mountain. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Big Thompson River and Miller Fork. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. THIS IS A LIFE THREATENING SITUATION! Heavy Rainfall will cause extensive and severe flooding of creeks, streams, roads and culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across roads in the warning area.
